function.description:
Returns a floating point number between 0 (no likeness) and 1 (identical), indicating how similar the source and target strings are.
This routine uses the Damereau Levenshtein distance to calculate the similarity. If the optional boolean argument relative is set to false, then the absolute distance will be returned rather than a relative distance.

example.title: Usage
example.code:
use String;
String.wordDistance("boy", "boy"); // 1 String.wordDistance("boy", "boys"); // 0.75 String.wordDistance("boys", "girl"); // 0 String.wordDistance("girls", "girlfriends"); // 0.4545454545454546 String.wordDistance("girls", "girlfriends", false); // 6
